revised_title: Asymptotic Analysis of Velocity Profiles in Prandtl Boundary Layer Theory
tldr: This article investigates the downstream asymptotic behavior of velocity profiles in the Prandtl boundary layer theory. It demonstrates that for a power law streaming speed, the velocity profile that develops downstream is asymptotically unique and similar to the Falkner-Skan similarity solution. The study also provides a theoretical justification for the role of similar solutions in boundary layer theory and proves the existence of concave velocity profiles when the pressure gradient is favorable.
